intro: Juglans elaepyren, commonly known as the Mexican walnut, is a species of flowering plant in the Juglandaceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of central Mexico, where it thrives in temperate climates. The plant produces large, round nuts encased in a thick, woody husk. Its leaves are alternate, compound, and typically have 15–23 leaflets. The Mexican walnut is valued for its edible seeds and has been used traditionally in local communities for food and medicinal purposes.
